li.a: Cleveland Clinic Sports Health Athletic Trainer

span.p: Click the followingÂ link for all MFCSD Coronavirus information:Â Â Â ALL MAYFIELD CITY SCHOOLS CORONAVIRUS UPDATES

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; color: #000000; font-family: " font-size: 13px; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 3px; text-align: left

p.span: During Governor DeWineâs update this afternoon, the governor announced as a result of the ongoing impact of the coronavirus,Â all K-12 students and teachers will continue and will complete their school year through online, remote learning only.
All Ohio schools, facilities and public school events remain closed as directed by the state, at this time.
Our Mayfield teachers are fully prepared and equipped to continue to educate our students through the end of the school year, May 28, 2020.
As we have repeated throughout this crisis, our goal remains the same â we will continue to instruct our students.

I would like to thank our teachers, students, staff, administrators and parents for their continued patience and understanding during these difficult and unforeseen circumstances. The words of support and encouragement for our students, teachers and staff speak volumes of who we are as a Mayfield community.

Of course, we all hoped to reunite this spring and complete our academic year together in our buildings and classrooms. We miss seeing everyoneâs smiling faces and our daily interactions, but the safety of our students, teachers, staff, parents and community remains our top priority.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; color: #000000; font-family: " font-size: 13px; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 3px; text-align: left
p.span: There are many resources available online for your health, safety and mental wellness. Mayfield Schools has a hub of resources related to the coronavirus pandemic and information to assist families. These resources can be found on our websiteÂ Â

a.span: Mayfield City Schools Coronavirus Information and Resources.

xml.style: box-sizing: border-box; color: #000000; font-family: " font-size: 13px; font-weight: 400; text-align: left

p.span: As we all know, the decisions surrounding this pandemic can change hour by hour and day by day. Please note, the governorâs Stay at Home Order remains in effect at this time. We will adhere to this schedule, unless otherwise directed by the state and health officials.Â
Please continue to practice the repeated health and safety recommendationsÂ â Stay home, wash your hands and practice strict social di
stancing. If you are ill or are experiencing possible symptoms, contact your health provider or call the Ohio Department of Health COVID-19 Hotline 1-800-4-ASKODH (1-800-427-5634).

Â There are many resources available online for your health, safety and mental wellness. Mayfield Schools has a hub of resources related to the coronavirus pandemic and information to assist families. These resources can be found on our websiteÂ
